definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: One cannot imagine mere human beings concocting such dreadful things, and one can scarcely imagine human beings bearing life in them.
sentences.chinese: 更令人想不到的是，居然还有人类在其中繁衍生息。

sentences.english: Oasis is an optimum geographic section for multi-life-forms to live and propagate together in the desert region.
sentences.chinese: 绿洲是荒漠区适宜多种生物共同生息繁衍的地域。

sentences.english: Now, years of doing this (a.k.a “deleveraging”) have restored purchasing power. Debts have been reduced or eliminated;
sentences.chinese: 如今，数年的“休养生息”重新塑造了强大的购买力。

sentences.english: 8A wolf pack is bedded down in the snow in Yellowstone national park.
sentences.chinese: 一群狼正在以黄石国家公园的雪地为床，休养生息。

sentences.english: Interest will get accruals if you keep your money in a savings account.
sentences.chinese: 把钱存在储蓄账户里就会生息。

sentences.english: We will make continued innovation on the way to rehabilitate overloaded rivers and lakes.
sentences.chinese: 继续创新让不堪重负的江河湖海休养生息的有效途径。

sentences.english: Now, years of doing this (a.k.a “deleveraging”) have restored purchasing power.
sentences.chinese: 如今，数年的“休养生息”重新塑造了强大的购买力。

sentences.english: Only the achievement of sustainable development, can humanity multiply their off-springs.
sentences.chinese: 只有实现可持续发展，人类才能世代繁衍生息。

sentences.english: It aims to rehabilitate and develop natural forests.
sentences.chinese: 主要解决天然林的休养生息和恢复发展问题。

sentences.english: For a long time, the people who live in arid area depend on the oasis to labor and live.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，此区的居民是藉赖绿洲生境而生息劳动。

sentences.english: Since the Shang Dynasty began, this piece of land there are human beings flourish.
sentences.chinese: 自商代开始，这片土地上就有人类繁衍生息。

sentences.english: They settled in "Kume Village", Ryukyu, lived and multiplied generation by generation.
sentences.chinese: 此后便定居琉球之“久米村”，世代繁衍生息。

sentences.english: Period and relax, adjust the mood.
sentences.chinese: 期间休养生息，调整心情。

sentences.english: External pressure for its slow created rehabilitate's golden days.
sentences.chinese: 外部压力的减缓为其创造了休养生息的黄金时期。

sentences.english: People named after Cao led a living and propagated generations.
sentences.chinese: 曹姓子民在此经营开拓，繁衍生息。

sentences.english: Fishing is now banned for two months of the year to allow marine life a chance to breed.
sentences.chinese: 每年禁渔两月，以给予海洋生物休养生息的机会。

definition: to multiply/to reproduce/to increase gradually in number or quantity
to grow and multiply without end
opportunity to live/to reprieve from death/life force/vitality
to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
to live in a cave/(of animals) to be of burrowing habit
